It is a simple DTO class that uses Lombok annotations to generate the necessary boilerplate code, such as constructors, getters, and setters. The class also includes various validation constraints using the Jakarta Validation API, ensuring that the input data meets certain criteria before being processed.\",\"/userservice/README.md\":\"This file appears to be a documentation for a Spring Boot microservice that handles user authentication and authorization using JWT tokens and a MySQL database. It does not contain any class or function definitions, but rather provides an overview of the service\\u0027s features, configuration, API endpoints, user roles, and instructions for setting up and running the service.\\n\\nThe file summarizes the following:\\n\\n1. User Service - Hospital Bed Tracker System: A Spring Boot microservice that handles user authentication and authorization using JWT tokens and MySQL database, and registers with Eureka Server for service discovery.\\n\\n2. Features: Includes JWT-based authentication and authorization, three user roles (ADMIN, STAFF, USER), BCrypt password encoding, MySQL database integration, Eureka client registration, comprehensive logging, and global exception handling.\\n\\n3. Configuration: Provides details about the application properties, including the port, database, Eureka Server, JWT secret, and JWT expiration.\\n\\n4. API Endpoints: Describes the available authentication and user management endpoints, including registration, login, token validation, and user management operations.\\n\\n5. User Roles: Explains the three user roles and their respective access levels.\\n\\n6. Prerequisites: Lists the required software and setup steps, including Java 17+, MySQL Server, Eureka Server, and database creation.\\n\\n7. Database Setup: Provides the SQL command to create the `MediTrackDB` database.\\n\\n8. Running the Service: Outlines the steps to run the application, including ensuring the MySQL and Eureka Server are running.\\n\\n9. Testing with Postman: Provides instructions for testing the service using Postman, including registration, login, token validation, and accessing protected endpoints.\\n\\n10. Response Examples: Includes sample JSON responses for successful login and token validation.\\n\\n11. Logging: Describes the comprehensive logging capabilities of the service, including user registration, login, token validation, user management operations, and security events.\",\"/adminservice/src/main/java/com/meditrack/adminservice/AdminServiceApplication.java\":\"This file is the main class for the AdminServiceApplication, which is a Spring Boot application that is enabled for service discovery.\\n\\n`AdminServiceApplication`: This is the main class that runs the Spring Boot application and enables service discovery.\\n\\n`main(String[] args)`: This is the main method that runs the Spring Boot application and prints a message indicating that the AdminService is running.\",\"/hospitalservice/src/test/java/com/bedtracker/hospitalservice/HospitalserviceApplicationTests.java\":\"This file appears to be a test class for a Spring Boot application. Instead, it sets up an Axios instance with a base URL for the Hospital Service and adds an interceptor to include an authorization token in the request headers if it is available in the local storage.\\n\\nThe file exports the following constants:\\n\\n`USER_SERVICE`: The base URL for the User Service\\n`HOSPITAL_SERVICE`: The base URL for the Hospital Service\\n`ADMIN_SERVICE`: The base URL for the Admin Service\\n\\nThe file also exports the Axios instance as the default export, which can be used to make HTTP requests to the Hospital Service.\",\"/Frontend/meditrack-frontend/src/context/AuthContext.jsx\":\"This file does not contain any classes. It contains the following functions:\\n\\n`AuthProvider`: This function is a React component that provides an authentication context to its child components, allowing them to access the user\\u0027s authentication state, login, and logout functions.\\n\\n`login`: This function is used to store the user\\u0027s authentication token in the browser\\u0027s local storage and update the user\\u0027s state in the authentication context.\\n\\n`logout`: This function is used to remove the user\\u0027s authentication token from the browser\\u0027s local storage and update the user\\u0027s state in the authentication context to `null`.\\n\\nIn summary, this file defines an authentication provider component that manages the user\\u0027s authentication state and provides login and logout functionality to its child components.\",\"/adminservice/src/main/java/com/meditrack/adminservice/filter/JwtAuthenticationFilter.java\":\"This file contains a single class and several functions. Here\\u0027s a summary of each:\\n\\n`JwtAuthenticationFilter`: A Spring Security filter that validates and processes JWT tokens for incoming requests.\\n\\n`doFilterInternal`: Filters incoming requests, validates the JWT token, extracts the user\\u0027s role, and sets the authentication in the security context if the token is valid and the user has the \\\"ADMIN\\\" role.\\n\\nThis file is responsible for implementing JWT-based authentication and authorization for the admin service. It checks the incoming requests for a valid JWT token, verifies the token, and ensures that the user has the \\\"ADMIN\\\" role before allowing access to the requested resource.\",\"/adminservice/src/main/java/com/meditrack/adminservice/service/AdminService.java\":\"This file contains the `AdminService` class and several functions that handle the administrative tasks for a hospital management system.\\n\\n`AdminService`: A service class that provides CRUD operations for hospitals, rooms, users, and receptionists.\\n\\n`getHeaders()`: A helper method that retrieves the authorization header from the current HTTP request and sets it in the headers for subsequent API calls.\\n\\n`exchange()`: A helper method that wraps the `RestTemplate.exchange()` call and handles exceptions.\\n\\n`callUser()`: A helper method that calls the user service using the `exchange()` method.\\n\\n`recalculateHospitalTotalBeds()`: A helper method that recalculates the total number of beds for a given hospital.\\n\\n`createHospital()`, `getAllHospitals()`, `getHospital()`, `updateHospital()`, `deleteHospital()`: CRUD operations for managing hospitals.\\n\\n`createRoom()`, `deleteUser()`: CRUD operations for managing users.\\n\\n`createReceptionist()`, `getAllReceptionists()`, `getReceptionist()`, `updateReceptionist()`, `deleteReceptionist()`: CRUD operations for context.\\n\\n`getRole()`: Retrieves the role from the current authentication context.\\n\\n`getUsername()`: Retrieves the username from the current authentication context.\\n\\nThis file is a utility class that provides methods to retrieve security-related information from the current authentication context, such as the hospital ID, receptionist ID, role, and username. It is likely used in a Spring Security-based application to access the authenticated user\\u0027s information.\",\"/hospitalservice/src/main/java/com/bedtracker/hospitalservice/dto/ApiResponse.java\":\"This file contains a single class `ApiResponse` and three static methods within that class.\\n\\n`ApiResponse`: A generic class that represents a response from an API, containing a success flag, a message, and optional data.\\n\\n`success(String message, T data)`: Creates a successful `ApiResponse` instance with the given message and data.\\n\\n`success(String message)`: Creates a successful `ApiResponse` instance with the given message and no data.\\n\\n`error(String message)`: Creates an unsuccessful `ApiResponse` instance with the given error message.\\n\\nThis file provides a standardized way to return API responses with a consistent structure, allowing for easy handling and processing of the responses.\",\"/hospitalservice/src/main/java/com/bedtracker/hospitalservice/controller/HospitalController.java\":\"This file is a Spring Boot controller class for managing hospital-related operations. It provides endpoints for fetching all hospitals, getting a specific hospital by ID, and creating a new hospital.\\n\\n`HospitalController`: A REST controller class that handles hospital-related HTTP requests.\\n\\n`getAllHospitals()`: Fetches all hospitals, with different behavior for admins and receptionists.\\n`getHospitalById(Long id)`: Fetches a specific hospital by its ID, with access control based on the user\\u0027s role.\\n`createHospital(HospitalRequest request)`: Creates a new hospital, but only allows admins to perform this operation.\",\"/DOCKER-README.md\":\"This file is a deployment guide for the Bed Tracker microservices system using Docker and Docker Compose. It provides instructions for setting up the required infrastructure, managing the services, and configuring the system.
